title: Usage Example​
content: local VelWatch = require(this.module) local newVelWatcher = VelWatch.new(true) --set to true if you want to see the velocity in a gui newVelWatcher:SetObject(AnimatedBasePart) newVelWatcher:Start() print(newVelWatcher.Velocity) print(newVelWatcher.RotVelocity) Copy

title: Mag Drop Example​
content: local magWatcher = VelWatch.new(false) magWatcher:Start(magPart) reloadAnim:GetMarkerReachedSignal("MagDrop"):Connect(function() local magClone: BasePart = magPart:Clone() magClone.CFrame = magPart.CFrame magClone.CanCollide = true magClone.Parent = workspace.Terrain magClone.AssemblyLinearVelocity = magWatcher.Velocity magClone.AssemblyAngularVelocity = magWatcher.RotVelocity task.wait(5) magClone:Destroy() end) Copy

title: ShowVelocityGui​
content: </> VelWatch.ShowVelocityGui: boolean A boolean that determines if the debug VelocityGui should be visible.

title: MonitoredObject​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> VelWatch.MonitoredObject: BasePart | Attachment  The object that is currently being watched by the VelWatch.

title: Velocity​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> VelWatch.Velocity: Vector3  The current velocity of the MonitoredObject.

title: RotVelocity​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> VelWatch.RotVelocity: Vector3  The current rotational velocity of the MonitoredObject.

title: new​
content: </> VelWatch.new(showVelocityGui: boolean) → VelWatch Creates a new VelWatch

title: SetObject​
content: </> VelWatch:SetObject(object: BasePart | Attachment | nil) → void Sets the MonitoredObject to the first argument

title: Start​
content: </> VelWatch:Start(object: BasePart | Attachment | nil) → void Starts watching the current MonitoredObject or if it is nil then it will set the first argument as the MonitoredObject.

title: Stop​
content: </> VelWatch:Stop() → void Stops watching the MonitoredObject

title: Destroy​
content: </> VelWatch:Destroy() → void Destroys the VelWatch object
